name: dosu
description: Dosu MCP server for accessing organization knowledge base

auth.note: OAuth 2.0 with Dynamic Client Registration. OpenCode will prompt for browser-based authentication on first use.

tools.name: init_knowledge
tools.description: Search Dosu knowledge store for task-relevant information. Use this at the start of any task to get context from Dosu-generated documentation, answers, and topics.

tools.name: search_documentation
tools.description: Search across documentation, Confluence pages, GitHub wikis, and knowledge base articles. Use this to find how-to guides, API references, and architectural decisions.

tools.name: search_threads
tools.description: Search through GitHub issues, discussions, Slack conversations, and other threaded discussions. Use this to find past solutions, bug reports, and team decisions.

tools.name: fetch_source
tools.description: Retrieve the full content of a source by its source_id. Use this after searching to get complete details when the summary isn't enough.

tools.name: save_topic
tools.description: Save an important topic to the knowledge base for future reference. Use this to capture key discoveries that can help your team later.

tools.name: greet
tools.description: Test the MCP connection and verify everything is working.

setup_instructions.step1: Add this configuration to ~/.config/opencode/opencode.json under the 'mcpServers' key
setup_instructions.step2: Restart OpenCode to load the new MCP server
setup_instructions.step3: On first use, OpenCode will prompt for OAuth authentication via browser
setup_instructions.step4: Test the connection by asking OpenCode to use the 'greet' tool
example_usage: Search Dosu for documentation about feature X
Find past GitHub issues related to bug Y
Look for Slack conversations about deployment Z
